args:
After Shingen's group hears that Quinbell—a town
with close relations to Hinomoto—is holding a
festival, they decide to stretch their legs and take
a stroll around the town.
You look so strong and impressive carrying\nthat float, Lord Shingen...
As Yachiyo said, this is a lively festival.\nThe walk was a good idea.
I'm so terribly pleased that you're enjoying\nyourselves, dearest Wyrmclan leaders.\nBut the main event is yet to come!
It'll be held on the main square stage.\nWe have a singing competition, a bingo\nmatch, a talk show—we do it all!
We're also inviting more special guests,\nso it would be simply PERFECT if you\nwere to share our excitement! Oho ho ho!
Sounds like fun to me. What say we all\nhead for the stage?
I prefer to wander alone, thank you.
Is this the talisman that Rikugo re-affixed\nto ward off the fiends? A bit of his mana\nremains on it...

(While chasing down the onmyoji Doman
who had defected to the Mukuroshu,
the shikigami Rikugo who served me
returned to mana.)
My Kodoku is being made manifest at last!\nYOU are my ultimate sorcery, Seimei!\nYou! Youuu! YOUUU!

The Mukuroshu was virtually annihilated.
I imagine you'd say something like,
＂How extremely delightful that it ends
in this way!＂ ...Hrgh!
Quinbell is a land related to Rikugo, yes?\nWere you thinking back on him?

I reported to my grandfather at his grave in
Hinomoto, but a shikigami like Rikugo
doesn't have a grave—so I came here to
tell him of the Mukuroshu's destruction.
I see. And if I may, was your spasm just\nnow an effect of the fell onmyodo curse\nyou received in the battle with Doman?
Yes. Since the business with Tsukuyomi,\nit's gone from a rather mild annoyance\nto terrific agony.
Passion can make one forget pain.\nThe Mukuroshu are a special enemy,\nfor they slaughtered your family.
Perhaps you didn't feel any pain because\nyou were working so hard to avenge them.
But with the enemy gone, the curse\ncannot be broken; I have no choice but\nto live with agony for the rest of my days.
Then permit me to confer upon you a spell\nthat might ease your suffering.
You would teach me, an onmyoji,\na spell? How amusing.
I trust you know I am not on good terms\nwith Kenshin of the Dragon Wyrmclan.
Mostlike because the two of you end up\narguing every time you meet.
Kenshin and I do not see eye-to-eye at all.\nWe are as water and oil—but I can live\nin the now BECAUSE he is there.

One time, I went to slay a fiend that had
appeared outside of town. But I took a
grievous wound, fled into the mountains,
and found myself alone and desperate.
But just when I had accepted my death,\nI experienced not the brilliant light of the\nafterlife, but Kenshin's odious face.

His visage floated into my mind and made
me ashamed at how I was giving up.
It rallied me back to my feet and turned
me into a man possessed.

The fiend who came to finish me found the
tables turned, and after defeating it I
walked back down the mountain. Oh, but
the vassal who greeted me was shocked!
So envisioning the face of one you hate\nis a spell to relieve pain?

Perhaps better to call him a natural rival
than a hated enemy. And competition
between two creatures drives them both
to heights of greater survival.
If you can picture your rival and compete\nwith them, it fills you with strength.
There you are! The talk show portion of\nthe event is about to begin, you know?
The special guest and famous enka singer,\nMarvelous Naoto! ...Who was Rikugo's\nform while serving as a spy, right?
But Rikugo returned to mana and is no\nmore. So who is that on the stage?
I'm delighted that we could meet again.\nWe never thanked you properly for what\nyou did to save our town back then.
Aw, heck! Don't go thinkin' nothin' of it!\n...Err, I mean, I merely did what anyone\nwould do.
Ooo! Are you going to sing for us again?
You'll have to forgive me. My throat is in\npoor form at the moment, so I'll have to\njust talk...
You sound different from how I remember.\nAre you REALLY Marvelous Naoto?
(Aw, this ain't good! They smell a rat!\nWhat'n the hey am I gonna do?!)
I need to speak with you. Now.
Wh-what? Um, but, we're in the middle\nof the talk session...
Uh...we'll be right back, I guess?
What the hell are you playing at,\nyou stupid fox?
You are supposed to be back in Hinomoto\nwatching over the Ox clan!

I knows it! But ya see, right after Lord
Seimei and everybody skedaddled,
we got us a request for Marvelous Naoto
to appear at this here hootenanny.
The people of this town dunno Rikugo's\ntrue form or the fact he bought the farm,\nso I sorta decided to accept in his place.
Did you seriously think you could pull that\noff? How could you be so stupid?!

Hey! Maybe I made a right mess of it,
but I don't regret it one bit! Them folks
woulda been disappointed as all get-out
what if I didn't.
Heck, they might'a even forgot about poor\nol' Rikugo, and that'd be a right shame.
The Mukuroshu might be whipped, but if\nour pals up and disappear from the world,\nwhat's it matter that we won?
Ha ha ha! Well said, little one. But what\nwill you do in the face of a servant who\nspeaks such truths, Seimei?
Tch. What other option do I have now\nthat the stupid fox went and did this?\n...But you're helping to fix it, Shingen!
Movements swift as wind!\nA stance stately as the silent forest!
(Shingen is standing in with his dance\nuntil Marvelous Naoto returns, but... Oh!)
My apologies for keeping you waiting.\nMy throat is better, and I am returned.
From here onward is my domain alone.\nThus I would ask you to incline your ears\nto me and let the music play!
Phew! I am worn from all the dancing.\nIs the Rikugo who cavorts upon the stage\nnow a new shikigami you created?

It's a copy of Rikugo made from the
mana left behind on the fiend-warding
talisman—but it's a simple spell that
lacks the original's sense of self.
More of a puppet, really, so I'm here\nmaking it sing from the wings of the\nstage. With any luck... Ngh! Gaaaaah!
A spasm caused by the fell curse, perhaps.
(Damn! The spell will break at this rate!)
Steady on now, Seimei. In the bottom of\nyour heart, who is watching you right now?\nWho is the one you must not lose to?
I'll not have you laugh at me, Doman!
Nothing to worry about now. I must focus\non making Rikugo's big moment one for\nthe ages!
The excitement on the stage grows to a fever pitch,\nand Marvelous Naoto completes the performance\nto great applause.

He was a high-level shikigami created by
putting together the minds and skills of
the greatest onmyoji. It'd be impossible to
completely bring him back on my own.
That's why I'm going to have you help me\nwith my onmyodo research, stupid fox.
If we can bring Rikugo back then perhaps\nwe can share some of Gozu Tenno's tea.
You put a hell of a curse on me, Shingen.\nEvery time the spasms start now, I'm going\nto see that man's damned face.
It makes me enough of a man possessed\nto forget the pain, so no. I thank you.
Heh. For some reason, I find myself\nwanting to see dear old Kenshin's face\nright about now...
